intro: Backeria, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species native to Africa, particularly in arid and semi-arid regions. The plants typically have basal leaves that are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Their flowers are showy, with five to seven petals that range in color from white to yellow. Backeria species are often found in rocky soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
